positive.review: This software is really great. At first I wasn’t sure about buying this because I seen a bunch of negative reviews. But as I read more I started realizing most of the negative reviews were from people upset about having to pay for the dlc which just seems kinda crazy to me criticizing a product for not including something that was never advertised as part of the base package is like trashing a game just because it doesn’t bundle content that was always meant to be sold separately. Dsx came out in 2022 as a standalone app while the dlc dropped in 2023. The dlc itself is totally worth it especially with all the features it brings like adaptive triggers, letting you control the light for the light bar, the mute led, and standard rumble feedback over both wired and wireless connections. Right now, it’s super cheap, and with the updates it’s supposed to get, I’d say it’s a steal at this price so definitely get it while you have the money for it.

in general a good program for using your PS controllers. which is why I bought this program, and since I use a PS5 controller it was a given to get this. 
but now all of a sudden they´ve hidden the dualsense features behind another paywall, which is why I got this program in the beginning to be able to use my PS5 controller fully.

other than that it works well
The only reason I didn't start PC gaming sooner was my love of the Playstation controller.  This has been the fix.
Very Clean UI, lot of features in it that are missing in others
It has good features but... why would i see the playtime of a software?
lets me use my ps5 controller with anygame with features that make it feel almost native

Ever run into the issue where your Dual Sense Edge won't work on a game?  This will force Normal Dual Sense or Dual Shock 4 mode or even xbox controller mode while retaining the caveats of the DSE controller.  Very customizable.  I highly recommend the DLC addon.

Only just installed it, but can already say it's a great piece of software for the DualSense on PC. The adaptive trigger settings are implemented really well and overall the software has a lot of granularity in the settings so you can set your controller up the way you want it. The devs are also really quick to respond on discord, help out and listen to feedback and the bundle price with the DLC isn't much more than the base software. Since I bought it with the DLC right away I can't speak to the base software without the DLC, but a recommendation is for someone who doesn't already own the software at all and there I'd say 100% recommended, get the bundle and you can avoid the complaints of previous reviews

Works as intended and helps with emulators on xbox games a lot. Vibrations work as intended in every game I play after a config. Adaptive features are the main reason I bought it. Lots of features and configs for the pro gamer.
Very good app and suggested specially for Edge Users! - Danial ZH
Great for connecting a controller to those games that say are compatible but just aren't

Great app if u want a PS5 experience in the pc , i rly love it and use it often
also excited about the BT haptic update that is coming soon
The team and the whole support of the app is amazing (often updates atleast 1 every week) and they answer almost instantly if u have a problem or dont understand something
The discord community is rly great 
bugs wise i would say its pretty minimal to alsmost nothing (its drastically improved since i started using it and even then i had 0 problems
overall the experience is rly great and a MUST if u own a dualsense
only really use it for xbox game pass games and it works great super easy to use and loads of customisation options

One of the hidden achievements is unlocked by mapping any button to the strongest move in any monster taming game. The move is, of course, stun seed. not because of its attack power but ratter because of how it is spelled backwards. Simply a genius app.

I've been using DSX for a few years and never really had any issues. I often use it to emulate Xbox controller - even today there is still a surprising amount of games that don't work with Dual Sense controller. Especially when using PC Game Pass DSX is great. I'm a little surprised about the bad reviews, so I'm adding one to the positive pile.
Works great. Deadzones are better than the free version DualSenseX
Full PS5 controller experience, now with wireless.
DualSense gaming. Very good! Can change stupid xbox AB buttons to PS5 XO buttons
Honestly, whenever I run an emulator the app comes in handy :)
It works. I turned my controller into a mouse which I control using the sticks. Really comfortable, who needs a mouse anymore? :D
“Would it be possible to add a rapid-fire feature that allows a specific button to be triggered repeatedly at high speed?”

So, I had a very strange error where Virtualpad would not install no matter what I did, I jumped to the discord and posted that I needed some help with the issue, the response was almost immediate from the Dev and after a bit of troubleshooting and probably making the Dev lose their minds a bit it was resolved and now I can use DSX fully again, I'm so grateful for the help and just saintlike patience from the Dev, can't recommend DSX enough just as a useful program but the Support is also unreal. 10/10 IGN would purchase again.

Niche software for DualSense, but Pay2Use DLC for Emulation is so ahh

it does what it says, just one bad thing before you buy: full, wireless support of this thing is in the DLC which costs extra money, so keep that in mind if you think you will be all set with only this piece of software

I honestly don't understand why it's "mixed" reviews here.
I mean it's great!
This is among the most feature-rich pieces of software I have seen in a long time.
Anything I could possibly want to adjust/configure/use my Dualsense is here!

Custom profiles - check
Can load profiles depending on game and switch back after closing - check
Adjust any button to do anything I want - check
Have all the data I could possibly ever need to see if my controller functions properly - check
Adjust lighting options and make them useful (battery indicator) - check
Starts up with windows and works seamlessly - check

And so so many more!
And with the DLC (Which is super cheap I paid like 2.50€ for it) I can even use the native Dualsense support in games that have it!
No more messing around with steam input and trying to get it to work.
It just works!
If there is one thing I'd like (And maybe there is and I haven't found it) then I'd like to be able to press a button combo and for DSX to fix the double input thing without me having to tab out of the game. Sometimes I launch the game before turning the controller on and then I have to tab out and go into DSX to fix it. Not a big issue or anything but a button combo that'd do that from within the game would be nice!

Aside from that top tier piece of software! Highly recommend it. Does everything I want and more and with no subscription BS or anything. Fair price for a good product.

Terrific piece of software to take full advantage of my DualSense Edge... or any other DualSense or DS4 controller!

Man, I love this app so much, even though the UI is a bit bloated and can feel overwhelming at first. But boy, this is WAY BETTER than DS4Windows. (Hey, DS4Windows is great freeware, don’t get me wrong.)

But DSX just offers so many QoL features that blow me away! Like the mute button actually being able to access my mic to mute or unmute me, finally giving that button a real purpose.

Customizing the adaptive triggers to work the way I fucking want is awesome, and the extra options for hotkeys are so lovely, this app is like watching Sonic X before school back in the day. You remember that feeling? something like that, dude. MUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUSSSSSSSSSSSSSTTTTTTTTTTT <3<3<3<3<3<3<3

I bought this specifically for the Virtual DualSense Emulation to use with my DualSense to fix the laziness of devs who don't enable Haptic Triggers unless plugged in via usb (why tho ghosts of tsushima and helldivers 2 both can do BT haptic triggers). It fixed that problem, I've seen most negative reviews are either for features like using xbox emulation (even though steam input does this fine) not working, and cache issues with the dlc but this does exactly what I needed and 8$ is worth the price to enable something that the game has but greedily keeps to usb only. I also see they are planning on adding audio support as well which is awesome too. Also looking forward to using this for the Fallout 4 and Skyrim mods for my next playthroughs of those games, but would be cooler if someone could mod Starfield support too.

I use my dualsense edge and ps4 controller for pc gaming and this software makes any of my controllers emulate an xbox whenever a game doesn't accept a playstation controller. I have zero issues getting things working with this software.

PLEASE FIX YOUR UI, IT IS NOT USER FRIENDLY AND WAY TOO COMPLICATED FOR LED AND SOUND.

Please simplify it in two tabs at least! Less info! Just simpler settings please! In beta everything works!

negative.review:
Alright, this software is great. It does an amazing job for providing a full dualsense immersion experience on a PC and that's the only good thing it has, alright.
I do get it that devs need money for their product so I was ok with new functions and some older ones moving to DLC. But the real pain in the ass is their product ownership check via Steam. Normally it wouldn't be an issue since you know, you boot up your PC, its instantly connected to the internet and once you launch this software - you dont even see this screen. But let's imagine a situation when your internet connection is down for some reason. Now you do the same steps as before but when you try to launch DSX it doesn't go past the license check screen - because you DON'T HAVE AN INTERNET CONNECTION. Simply lovely! 
Listen devs, I do get that you want to be rewarded by your work, but this 'anti-piracy' screen is hilarious and I don't believe that it works at all. 

Anyway if you don't find a trouble with the issues listed above then sure, buy this software. For everyone else I'd suggest to steer clear from it and spend some time finding alternatives.

At this moment im wondering why I bought this? At first it was a god send now some features are locked behind paying MORE. I get needing money but why not increase the price? At the very least not rip features from early adopters. And whats this about always online? its software to help ease ds5 and pc use not like a social platform, we literally bought this from steam. Word of mouth can make or break smaller sized projects like this and rather than usher older customers into new features we just ask them to pay more with newer prospects too. Idk man i cant in good conscience recommend this.

I've never seen a worse program. They want money for functionality that only Malcolm can figure out. I launch the game, Dual Sense works, but something clicks, and all the lights on the gamepad flash. Why?

I've been trying to get my PS5 controller to work and it seems like everything is scrambled all the time. At one point the program was reading the gyro as the joystick and refused to let me map anything in a functional way. I've gotten this program to work once and it was great. After that, updates or no reason that I can tell automatically changes so many settings that going through trying to get things to work is more trouble than it's worth. 

Today I wanted to try it again. profiles don't keep things the same, everything feels random and it feels like I have to force the program to do something it's not supposed to do in order to get it to make the controller act like the most basic PC USB controller you can buy. 

I'm really burnt out from this software. It looks amazing. There's all kinds of configurations you can do if you can get it to work and stick. It just makes my PS5 controller into nothing but a fancy, random paperweight with annoying rainbow effects and the weirdest mapping as if having the audacity to change a configuration was some kind of sin.
i feel scammed, startup and process of program is depended by steam account. when i want to play a game on my main, i need to buy DSX there too. thats just pure scam from an utility software
It is completely broken now. Causes a tons of phantom inputs in the dualsense edge controller and therefore is useless for gaming.

I bought it specifically to bring back haptic function to my ps5 controller on my pc. It can't do that wirelessly. So I definitely can't recommend it, as it fails at what I got it for. it DID bring back some rumble but I'm not sure it's worth the price.

Edit: I got an update that mentions them working on returning haptic feedback to wireless controllers. IF they do, I will change my review to say it's worth it. but as it stands I'm still on the fence.

ive been using this for years now, and ive always loved it. but they have finally lost me, this new update makes it completely  unusable nothing works anymore its sooo buggy. Super disappointed, because i used to use this every day and it was so good and reliable, and they've ruined it, by just doing to much. I say if it aint broke don't try to fix it.

whole app is confusing. every update makes each previous tutorials impossible to follow and they keep changing the most unecessary shit. probably the most frustrated ive ever been trying to do something as simple as CONNECTING A F**KING controller. mouth-breathing devs unfortunately.
So far emulating different controllers worket fine but for some reason now the app doesnt work at all even outside of beta

There is other software with the same features and you can run them offline.
This has no offline support and costs money for a better looking UI and that is it.

No offline support is the major issue with this product.
Use an alternative if you require offline support...

After more than 2 years, DSX still fails to deliver on the promise of "Console-like Dualsense over Bluetooth on PC". Devs keep pushing updates, miscommunication lingers. It's good for non-dualsense games. Good for actually making the controller work across all launchers and games, but forget proper dualsense features. The software is bloated with nonsense bloatware that almost nobody uses. The whole program's feel is like "a hobby". And it shows with updates and how much time it takes to make small steps toward complete dualsense support on PC. And it's in contrast with the price and pricing. 10€ for this? A program that sometimes works, sometimes doesn't? For a hobby, it should be free. Or if you really want to milk people actually treat it as a job. Do it regularly, weekly - upmost. If I could, I would refund. I already refunded the DSX+ dlc, because that's a complete scam for 5€. There are actual GAMES for that price. Games that beat the breath of this "hobby" project. I advise everyone NOT TO buy this. Instead download ds4windows to use the dualsense. Atleast that's free.
Used before and worked great but now when I launch it I am stuck on a "Welcome" screen that won't allow me to press okay or exit the program. My only option is force quit. Seems to no longer work.
btw this guy removes steam reviews, pls do not buy, use open source alternatives and not use DRM infested drivers

I just want to be clear here in case some would be smart to know the following, Yes i do like the dsx in many ways since the free version. But i disliked it because its not steam deck compatible....and...part of me wished it was but it isn't so i'm kind of hoping it'll happen. So....there's that

good for adding adaptive triggers to games without them

bad for adding gyro to games with adaptive trigger or other dualsense feature support

for example, i tried playing cyberpunk using this to use its native dualsense support with gyro and flick stick, but unlike steam input its way too hard to actually set up 1:1 gyro and flickstick then adjust the sensitivity.

steam input? just look the game up on mouse-sensitivity dot com and then set your sense and set the unit to counts, copy and paste that into the dots per 360, then adjust your sensitivity to your liking (i use around 7x sense). on top of that theres a bunch of great features like gyro ratcheting on touching the touchpad, adjusting the vertical sense ratio, changing to yaw/roll or player/local/world space ect.

DSX? you get a slider that has no actual frame of reference. do you want 30, or 72?

"Bluetooth Audio and Haptic Feedback BETA [NOW AVAILABLE]"

The program does not have Bluetooth audio enabled yet for PS5 controllers. BT audio is currently locked behind a private beta. You can buy DSX, you can buy DSX+, but it still won't get you audio through your headphones or sound from your controller's microphone. The only feature currently available is haptic feedback based on your audio.

Irresponsible to advertise this feature and then lock it away.
shitty code that crashed my windows a bunch

Lately it's causing my PS5 controller to be extremely slow and laggy. The INSTANT I close the app, the controller is fast and snappy. I'm about to uninstall this app and find an alternative to give the touchpad some use.
The new app is slow AF, it's clunky. Why does it need Internet? I found it better to plug it in via usb and not use this app anymore, wouldn't recommend anymore.

Don't know why the option to to assign back buttons for the edge controller was removed for the Native option... Been using this for years and I have to to use the native option for certain games. I guess I'll have to find something else to use.

The person who designed this new UI must have schizophrenia, or maybe they're an alien. The most convoluted, messy, un-intuitive design I have ever seen. Remapping buttons, one of the only things this app is used for, is literal rocket science, it would be easier to write your own program from scrath and use that than it is to simply remap one button to another . IF IT AIN'T BROKE, DON'T FIX IT.

Get ready to get frustrated.  On install, vibration will only work on xbox emulation.  For ps5, ps4 emulation, vibration does not work until going through all the settings and tweaks and finally finding the right one.  Oh and once you do, you will realize that the standard ps5 vibration without emulation is not the same using this software whether you do the pass through or not.  I bought this software in hopes of finding a piece of software that would help me since i have a ps5 controller and hate having to switch back and forth or turn off profiles in other emulation software like ds4 windows and never fully getting the ps5 controller experience.  Some games like Gotham knights, gets a double input on the down and up buttoms, no fix found, tried the fix double input button in the software with no luck.  On battlefield 6, the adaptive trigger passthrough works slightly, right trigger does, left trigger doesnt. Tried looking up support on steam's product support and their webpage is broken.   If you cannot get the vibration to work on ps5 or 4 emulation, try enabling haptic feedback mode, it works but it will be very weak as compared to the normal ps5 vibration.  So in conclusion, the best way to get a ps5 controller experience, just disable this software. 3+ hours trying to tackle each issue I am having with this software.  Any tips or solutions are welcome.  So far cant get the vibration to feel like a normal ps5 should feel and I am referring to games that do support ps5 native vibration and controllers.

Make sure to disable in steam, enable steam input for xbox controllers, this will cause multiple blue screen crashes.
I love features I already had getting paywalled. fuck you

need dlc to use properly
terrible cant do nothing on this app
it does not work
It keeps crashing my windows.
not reponse many time
can't map paddles

Alright, this software is great. It does an amazing job for providing a full dualsense immersion experience on a PC and that's the only good thing it has, alright.
I do get it that devs need money for their product so I was ok with new functions and some older ones moving to DLC. But the real pain in the ass is their product ownership check via Steam. Normally it wouldn't be an issue since you know, you boot up your PC, its instantly connected to the internet and once you launch this software - you dont even see this screen. But let's imagine a situation when your internet connection is down for some reason. Now you do the same steps as before but when you try to launch DSX it doesn't go past the license check screen - because you DON'T HAVE AN INTERNET CONNECTION. Simply lovely! 
Listen devs, I do get that you want to be rewarded by your work, but this 'anti-piracy' screen is hilarious and I don't believe that it works at all. 

Anyway if you don't find a trouble with the issues listed above then sure, buy this software. For everyone else I'd suggest to steer clear from it and spend some time finding alternatives.

Besides the controversial redesign and updated monetization model, the program now strictly requires an Internet connection to function, which is even more inappropriate for a controller emulation/customization app in my opinion.

At this moment im wondering why I bought this? At first it was a god send now some features are locked behind paying MORE. I get needing money but why not increase the price? At the very least not rip features from early adopters. And whats this about always online? its software to help ease ds5 and pc use not like a social platform, we literally bought this from steam. Word of mouth can make or break smaller sized projects like this and rather than usher older customers into new features we just ask them to pay more with newer prospects too. Idk man i cant in good conscience recommend this.
New version is awful, super slow and unresponsive.

Worst update ever. last update worked completely fine and the developers changed everything. the UI is terrible and there is no launch button or any information how to reduce the input delay on my controller or even activate it when launching my game. Everything worked fine before and now the button mapping I previously had set does not work and I have no clue how to re-map the inputs. I have been messing with the program for 40 minutes now and no luck its just not working. completely ridiculous breaking something that isn't broken.

I've never seen a worse program. They want money for functionality that only Malcolm can figure out. I launch the game, Dual Sense works, but something clicks, and all the lights on the gamepad flash. Why?

Use literally any other PS5 controller solution. This one gets worse with every update, paywalls features, and has always online DRM. The most recent update broke the one thing I use it for. I only use it to achieve a gamecube-like trigger effect. That's all I need this program to do. It's all I ever asked the program to do for me. I have to take time out of my ever-shortening life to parse though the god-awful UI and try to figure out how to achieve what I need it to do for me after this new update. I checkbox "Gamecube" unofficial adaptive triggers. Nothing happens. The appropriate term for this is "verschlimmbessern." It didn't have to suddenly disable gamecube triggers for me when it updated, but the most recent update most certainly did so. It is a constant theme that every update makes the program worse, from the 1.0 update to the 2.1 update, and now from the 2.1 ui to the 3.1 UI. Do not buy this program!
functionality is clunky at best . not worth the money

I've been trying to get my PS5 controller to work and it seems like everything is scrambled all the time. At one point the program was reading the gyro as the joystick and refused to let me map anything in a functional way. I've gotten this program to work once and it was great. After that, updates or no reason that I can tell automatically changes so many settings that going through trying to get things to work is more trouble than it's worth. 

Today I wanted to try it again. profiles don't keep things the same, everything feels random and it feels like I have to force the program to do something it's not supposed to do in order to get it to make the controller act like the most basic PC USB controller you can buy. 

I'm really burnt out from this software. It looks amazing. There's all kinds of configurations you can do if you can get it to work and stick. It just makes my PS5 controller into nothing but a fancy, random paperweight with annoying rainbow effects and the weirdest mapping as if having the audacity to change a configuration was some kind of sin.

Edit: I got an update that mentions them working on returning haptic feedback to wireless controllers. IF they do, I will change my review to say it's worth it. but as it stands I'm still on the fence.

Lately it's causing my PS5 controller to be extremely slow and laggy. The INSTANT I close the app, the controller is fast and snappy. I'm about to uninstall this app and find an alternative to give the touchpad some use.

After more than 2 years, DSX still fails to deliver on the promise of "Console-like Dualsense over Bluetooth on PC". Devs keep pushing updates, miscommunication lingers. It's good for non-dualsense games. Good for actually making the controller work across all launchers and games, but forget proper dualsense features. The software is bloated with nonsense bloatware that almost nobody uses. The whole program's feel is like "a hobby". And it shows with updates and how much time it takes to make small steps toward complete dualsense support on PC. And it's in contrast with the price and pricing. 10€ for this? A program that sometimes works, sometimes doesn't? For a hobby, it should be free. Or if you really want to milk people actually treat it as a job. Do it regularly, weekly - upmost. If I could, I would refund. I already refunded the DSX+ dlc, because that's a complete scam for 5€. There are actual GAMES for that price. Games that beat the breath of this "hobby" project. I advise everyone NOT TO buy this. Instead download ds4windows to use the dualsense. Atleast that's free.

Just use Steams built in controller systems.
Or DS4Windows.
Cool, I get haptic triggers.
But most games on PC now support DS5 by default with default game functions... But then, the Steam Input system makes this entire app pointless.

I am using a PS5 controller. You can customize the triggers the way you like, and for games that don't have adaptive trigger support, you can add it on your own with this software. That part is very nice, but that is about as much customization as you can do other than the normal stuff, like creating profiles or changing lightbar colors.

I'm giving this a negative review because the haptic feedback doesn't have many options—it isn't as customizable as the triggers. I am also leaving a negative review for one more reason: if you want to use any of the DualSense features, you have to buy the DLC. Why? I don't know. Is it greed, or is it another reason?
Program was flawless for a time.  Now after problem after problem it seems like the developer has given up on stability over a few new shiny features.  Do not recommend in its current state.
Used before and worked great but now when I launch it I am stuck on a "Welcome" screen that won't allow me to press okay or exit the program. My only option is force quit. Seems to no longer work.

This thing is more os a pain than its worth. First off you have to buy the "DLC" for dualsense support, which is most likely why are you here looking at this. Even so, its cheap enough, whatever. It makes it sound to simple to use but its such a pain. I couldn't even get it to work properly in game, and most games couldn't even get controller to work at all as it kept popping up an error script everytime I tried to use the controller in a game, and that was even with the "native" function selected and the suggested functions enabled. Tried it in Baldurs Gate to hopefully add vibration to the dualsense since Larian couldn't be bothered to add it themselves, and it just made everything weird. The game thought I was an additional player joining, I guess it was recognizing my controller as an additional one with this app idk, but made playing it weird as it didn't recognize my controller as being the main player and couldn't well, control my character and all properly. After all that and an hour of messing around I just had enough and refunded. I don't need more complications in my life to be honest. I'd rather just play normally than to spend all my time messing with this just to end up playing the same or worse anyway lol
the app updated to v3 and it completely crashed all games that i try running. You also cant backtrack to older app versions that actually ran properly.

This program will get your steam account VAC ban for just having install on your system. As I got perma banned from call of duty for having it installed. It should have a warning from steam before you buy it. 10 years plus of gaming down the drain and who know how much money.

In Avatar Frontiers of pandora and in Far Cry 6, xbox icons blinking without playstation icons. The connected Dualshok 4 is blinking lightbar by wire and it cannot be turned off in any way. The program's interface is overloaded, and it's not immediately clear where, how, or what. Does not see the installed hidhide. The program support cannot be contacted - the link leads to a non-working website. I shouldn't have bought it despite the mixed reviews in steam.  There are no such problems with DS4Windows.

good for adding adaptive triggers to games without them

bad for adding gyro to games with adaptive trigger or other dualsense feature support

for example, i tried playing cyberpunk using this to use its native dualsense support with gyro and flick stick, but unlike steam input its way too hard to actually set up 1:1 gyro and flickstick then adjust the sensitivity.

steam input? just look the game up on mouse-sensitivity dot com and then set your sense and set the unit to counts, copy and paste that into the dots per 360, then adjust your sensitivity to your liking (i use around 7x sense). on top of that theres a bunch of great features like gyro ratcheting on touching the touchpad, adjusting the vertical sense ratio, changing to yaw/roll or player/local/world space ect.

DSX? you get a slider that has no actual frame of reference. do you want 30, or 72?
Changed from a simple USER FRIENDLY UI to a UI that the DEVS probably cant even navigate. worst update

This app used to be very good but there was an update and now there is an ABSURD amount of input delay when using the Xbox Emulation mode. I have verified that with multiple controllers on different games and even using input tests. Hopefully the devs will figure out the issues and re update as this app isn't worth what they are charging.

"Bluetooth Audio and Haptic Feedback BETA [NOW AVAILABLE]"

The program does not have Bluetooth audio enabled yet for PS5 controllers. BT audio is currently locked behind a private beta. You can buy DSX, you can buy DSX+, but it still won't get you audio through your headphones or sound from your controller's microphone. The only feature currently available is haptic feedback based on your audio.

Irresponsible to advertise this feature and then lock it away.

Version 3.1.3.1 is terrible and overly complicated. Please give users the option to use the old version. The app was a great but the developers over complicated things, I will be going back to using DS4 Windows.

This application is really cool, but cod put me in a shadowban lobby because I was using this application while playing the game.  Turns out, many others have this issue too (just search cod dsx ban on Google).

DSX is now triggering Call of Duty's Ricochet and most likely Battlefield 6's Javelin too (along with Fortnite's EAC etc).  If you play multiplayer games on PC DO NOT DOWNLOAD THIS SOFTWARE.

These anti cheat do not target the DSX app itself (the dev is technically correct, but he is lying by omission), they do however see ViGEmBus and HidHide as potential cheat programs because they run at ring 0 on the kernel level (and they do not like the Nefarious driver also).  I would not risk a ban if you play competitive games.

It's a strange piece of software. Even though I saw the mixed review, wanted to give it a try, but most features don't seem to work. No matter how much I fiddled with the setting, I could not control the LED and the triggers. I could set up some motion controls and remap controls, so it's not completely useless, but it really isn't a good value for your money.

I just want to be clear here in case some would be smart to know the following, Yes i do like the dsx in many ways since the free version. But i disliked it because its not steam deck compatible....and...part of me wished it was but it isn't so i'm kind of hoping it'll happen. So....there's that

Get ready to get frustrated.  On install, vibration will only work on xbox emulation.  For ps5, ps4 emulation, vibration does not work until going through all the settings and tweaks and finally finding the right one.  Oh and once you do, you will realize that the standard ps5 vibration without emulation is not the same using this software whether you do the pass through or not.  I bought this software in hopes of finding a piece of software that would help me since i have a ps5 controller and hate having to switch back and forth or turn off profiles in other emulation software like ds4 windows and never fully getting the ps5 controller experience.  Some games like Gotham knights, gets a double input on the down and up buttoms, no fix found, tried the fix double input button in the software with no luck.  On battlefield 6, the adaptive trigger passthrough works slightly, right trigger does, left trigger doesnt. Tried looking up support on steam's product support and their webpage is broken.   If you cannot get the vibration to work on ps5 or 4 emulation, try enabling haptic feedback mode, it works but it will be very weak as compared to the normal ps5 vibration.  So in conclusion, the best way to get a ps5 controller experience, just disable this software. 3+ hours trying to tackle each issue I am having with this software.  Any tips or solutions are welcome.  So far cant get the vibration to feel like a normal ps5 should feel and I am referring to games that do support ps5 native vibration and controllers.

Make sure to disable in steam, enable steam input for xbox controllers, this will cause multiple blue screen crashes.
